title: Introducing: Saint Savanna
content:
Mumford & Sons have ruined so much that was once dear to so many: berets, banjos and stereotypical Britishness, to name but a few.

Having left a sizeable brown mark on the underpants of folk-pop, what makes it even worse is that bands like The Lumineers appear to enjoy trying to replicate the sort of mind-numbing drivel that Mumford & Co. excrete. A minute  or so into this debut EP from Brighton’s Saint Savanna and you’d be forgiven for thinking that they’re just another tweed-wearing, genre-blaspheming bunch of fanny-monkeys. Thankfully, it’s not stereotypical of their sound, and by the time the chorus of You Won’t Rise kicks in, they’ve well and truly extinguished any Mumford related demons.

With lines like “thank you for being so brutally honest, but fuck you for saying that you didn’t want this“, there’s a snarl to Saint Savanna that is rarely experienced in a ‘folky’ outfit. In truth, it’s only the opening track that has any hints of Mumford to it; Balconies is dream-pop at it’s finest – slightly cheesy and irrepressibly slick. One gets the feeling that Saint Savanna are still to find their ‘internet feet’, mainly due to their modestly sized fanbase in proportion to the quality of their music, however with the right direction, expect to hear a lot more of them over the coming months.
